intro: Erysimum gomez-campoi, commonly known as the Gomez-Campoi wallflower, is a species of flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is native to the coastal regions of southern California, where it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and produces clusters of bright yellow or orange flowers. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in a fine layer of white hair. Erysimum gomez-campoi is adapted to drought conditions and is often found in disturbed or rocky habitats.
